ThinkWell is seeking a Health Financing Advisor for the four-year USAID Liberia Strategic Technical Assistance for Improved Health System Performance and Health Outcomes (STAIP) project. The STAIP Activity aims to improve health system performance and strengthen the delivery of primary health care services.  A major focus of this program includes support to meaningful reforms in the area of health financing including delivery of selected priorities in alignment with the MOH’s Liberia Health Equity Fund (LHEF) to ensure quality and equitable access to health services without undue financial burden to patients.
The Health Financing advisor will lead the technical assistance support to the Ministry of Health (MoH) and will report the Chief of Party, while also receiving line management support from ThinkWell’s HF Program Lead based in Washington DC.

The HF Advisor will work within the MOH’s Healthcare Financing Unit to support efforts to increase financial risk protection and improve health sector financing in line with LHEF priorities, including development and testing of health financing reforms. Areas of responsibility will include:
 
Provide leadership for STAIP health financing objectives at the national level including, design and piloting of the Liberia health equity fund (LHEF), public financial management, and performance-based financing for selected counites
 
Collaborate with multiple stakeholders to contribute to all health sector related policy and regulatory reforms that will drive and accelerate implementation of the LHEF; this may include developments related to the national health financing strategy and plan
